variations.name: Downward Dog - Bent Knees Modification
instructions: Start on hands and knees in tabletop position
Tuck toes under and lift hips toward ceiling
Keep knees slightly bent to protect lower back
Press palms firmly into mat, spreading fingers wide
Keep head between arms, neck relaxed
Hold for 5-8 breaths, focusing on lengthening spine

variations.name: Downward Dog - Standard
instructions: From tabletop, tuck toes and lift hips
Straighten legs as much as hamstring flexibility allows
Create an inverted V-shape with body
Press heels toward floor (they may not touch)
Keep arms straight, shoulders away from ears
Engage core to protect lower back
Hold for 8-10 breaths, breathing deeply

variations.name: Downward Dog - One Leg Lift
instructions: Establish standard downward dog position
Shift weight slightly into left hand and foot
Lift right leg high, keeping hips square
Keep both shoulders level, avoid twisting
Engage core strongly to maintain stability
Hold for 5 breaths, then switch sides
Return to standard downward dog between sides

variations.name: Warrior II - Modified Stance
instructions: Start in standing position, step feet wide apart
Turn right foot out 90 degrees, left foot slightly in
Bend right knee to a shallow angle (not fully to 90)
Keep front knee tracking over ankle, not past toes
Extend arms parallel to floor at shoulder height
Gaze over front middle finger
Hold for 5-7 breaths, focusing on hip stability

variations.name: Warrior II - Standard
instructions: Step feet 4-5 feet apart in wide stance
Turn right foot out 90 degrees, left foot 15 degrees in
Bend right knee to 90-degree angle, thigh parallel to floor
Keep front knee stacked directly over ankle
Square hips toward side of mat, engage core
Reach arms parallel to floor, active through fingertips
Gaze over front middle finger, keep neck aligned
Hold for 8-10 breaths with steady, deep breathing

variations.name: Warrior II - Extended Hold with Reverse Bind
instructions: Establish standard Warrior II position
Maintain 90-degree front knee bend and hip alignment
Reach back arm up and overhead, then behind back
Reach front arm down and behind back, clasping hands
Open chest and shoulders, avoid collapsing forward
Keep core engaged and hips level throughout bind
Hold for 5-8 breaths, then release and switch sides
This variation requires significant shoulder mobility

variations.name: Tree Pose - Foot at Ankle
instructions: Stand on left leg, shift weight into standing foot
Place right foot on inside of left ankle (avoid knee)
Find a focal point on the floor to maintain balance
Press foot into ankle and ankle into foot for stability
Keep hips level, avoid leaning to either side
Hold for 5-7 breaths, then switch legs
Focus on rooting down through standing leg

variations.name: Tree Pose - Foot at Calf
instructions: Stand on left leg, establish balance
Bend right knee and place foot on inside of left calf
Press foot firmly into calf, avoid pressure on knee joint
Keep hips square and level, engage standing leg glute
Bring hands to heart center (Anjali Mudra)
Fix gaze on a stable point ahead
Hold for 8-10 breaths with steady breathing
Maintain core engagement throughout

variations.name: Tree Pose - Full with Arms Overhead
instructions: Establish tree pose with foot at inner thigh
Press lifted foot firmly into standing leg
Engage standing leg strongly, rooting through foot
Maintain hip alignment and square pelvis
Reach arms overhead, keeping shoulders relaxed
Option to bring palms together or keep arms parallel
Fix gaze on a point ahead, breathe steadily
Hold for 10-15 breaths, building balance and focus

variations.name: Child's Pose - Standard
instructions: Start on hands and knees in tabletop position
Sit back on heels, big toes touching
Knees can be together or slightly apart
Lower torso between thighs, forehead toward mat
Extend arms forward, palms down
Relax shoulders and breathe deeply into back body
Hold for 10-20 breaths or as needed for recovery
This is a resting pose - find comfort and ease

variations.name: Child's Pose - Extended Arms
instructions: Begin in standard child's pose position
Keep hips back on heels, maintain position
Walk hands further forward, extending reach
Press palms actively into mat, engage latissimus
Feel stretch through shoulders, armpits, and side body
Keep hips grounded, don't lift off heels
Breathe deeply and hold for 10-15 breaths
To deepen, press hips back more actively

variations.name: Child's Pose - Side Stretch Variation
instructions: Start in extended child's pose position
Keep both palms planted, maintain hip position
Walk hands to the right side of mat
Feel stretch through left side body and latissimus
Keep hips centered, avoid shifting weight
Breathe into the stretch, hold for 5-8 breaths
Walk hands back to center, then repeat on left side
Focus on lateral flexion and rotation of spine

variations.name: Triangle Pose - With Block Support
instructions: Step feet 3-4 feet apart, turn right foot out 90 degrees
Turn left foot in slightly, keep both legs straight
Reach right arm down, placing hand on block inside right foot
Block height: start high, lower as flexibility increases
Extend left arm up toward ceiling, palm facing forward
Open chest and hips toward side of mat
Keep both legs engaged, avoid locking knees
Hold for 5-8 breaths, then switch sides

variations.name: Triangle Pose - Standard
instructions: Step feet wide apart (about 4 feet), right foot out 90 degrees
Left foot turns in 15 degrees, keep both legs straight and strong
Extend arms parallel to floor, reaching to opposite sides
Hinge at right hip, reaching right hand down to shin or ankle
Keep torso long, avoid collapsing into front leg
Extend left arm straight up, opening chest and shoulders
Gaze up toward top hand or forward for neck comfort
Keep hips level, engage core, hold for 8-10 breaths

variations.name: Triangle Pose - Reverse Bind
instructions: Establish standard triangle pose position
Maintain strong foundation in both legs
Reach top arm behind back, palm facing out
Reach bottom arm around front leg, clasping hands behind leg
This bind requires significant shoulder and chest flexibility
Open chest further, rotating torso toward ceiling
Keep legs engaged and hips level throughout bind
Hold for 5-8 breaths, focusing on breath in restricted position
Release carefully and switch sides
